citeinfo.origin: University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory
citeinfo.title: High-Resolution Land Cover, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Chesapeake Bay Watershed and Delaware River Basin, 2013

cntorgp.cntorg: University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory
University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory

idinfo.datacred: This land-cover dataset was developed by the University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory. The original development of the algorithms used for this project was done in collaboration with the United States Forest Service. Funding for the Delaware River Basin portion was provided by the William Penn Foundation under a collaborative grant with Shippensburg University. Funding for the Chesapeake Bay Watershed portion was provided by the National Park Service and Environmental Protection Agency under a collaborative grant with the Chesapeake Conservancy.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.0.3348

attracc.attraccr: No accuracy assessment was performed for this layer, but previous projects using the same workflow (automated feature extraction followed by extensive manual QA\QC) routinely achieved overall accuracies exceeding 90%.

qattracc.attracce: Point-based accuracy assessments were used with previous projects using the same workflow (automated feature extraction followed by extensive manual QA\QC).

dataqual.logic: Each cell has been assigned a valid land cover code.
dataqual.complete: Complete coverage for the study area using the most recent boundary data.

srcinfo.srccontr: Leaf-off, 3-band, 1-foot (0.3-meter) resolution orthoimagery acquired for Pennsylvania during the period 2005-2008.
Leaf-on, 4-band, 3.281-foot (1-meter) resolution orthoimagery from the National Agricultural Imagery Program (NAIP), acquired in 2013.
Ancillary vector datasets, including LiDAR-derived breaklines for roads and hydrology.
Leaf-off, 3.281-foot (1-meter) resolution LiDAR for Pennsylvania, acquired during the period 2006-2008.

procstep.procdesc: Object based image analysis (OBIA) using a rule-based expert system

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

edom.edomvd: Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces

attr.attrdef: Land cover class 0 - Background 1 - Water 2 - Emergent Wetlands 3 - Tree Canopy 4 - Scrub/Shrub 5 - Low Vegetation 6 - Barren 7 - Structures 8 - Other Impervious Surfaces 9 - Roads 10 - Tree Canopy over Structures 11 - Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces 12 - Tree Canopy over Roads

overview.eaover: Twelve land cover classes were mapped: 0 - Background 1 - Water 2 - Emergent Wetlands 3 - Tree Canopy 4 - Scrub/Shrub 5 - Low Vegetation 6 - Barren 7 - Structures 8 - Other Impervious Surfaces 9 - Roads 10 - Tree Canopy over Structures 11 - Tree Canopy over Other Impervious Surfaces 12 - Tree Canopy over Roads

cntorgp.cntorg: University of Vermont Spatial Analysis Laboratory

metainfo.metuc: The organizations responsible for generating and funding this dataset make no representations of any kind including, but not limited to the warranties of merchantability or fitness for a particular use, nor are any such warranties to be implied with respect to the data.Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors may be reflected in data supplied. The user must be aware of data conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, original map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other condition. Secondary distribution must be accompanied by this documentation. Credit should always be given to the data source when this data is transferred, altered, or used for analysis.
